job1.title: Internship/Working Student
job1.description1: Contributed to the development of VoIP solutions on Azure, enhancing system scalability and reliability.
job1.description2: Assisted the team in building and optimizing infrastructure and SaaS platforms within the Azure environment, leading to improved deployment efficiency and performance.

job2.title: Internship
job2.description1: Engineered macro-level packet distribution for LTE technologies using Java, working closely with cross-functional teams to address technical challenges.

job3.title: Student Assistant
job3.description1: Provided support to over 200 students per semester in electronics labs, facilitating lab sessions and troubleshooting technical issues.
job3.description2: Assisted in the setup and execution of experiments, improving lab efficiency.

degree1.title: Computer and Information Science/Masters Degree - Software Engineering/Masters Degree
degree1.description: Focusing on advanced software engineering principles and cloud computing technologies.

degree2.title: Software Engineer & Electrics and Electronics Engineer
degree2.description: Dual degree program covering both software engineering and electronics engineering fundamentals.

project1.title: Component Diagram Editor using Eclipse GLSP and Sprotty
project1.description: This project is a graphical language server protocol (GLSP) application that aims to create and manage component-based diagrams. It leverages technologies such as NMF, Eclipse GLSP, Sprotty, and Inversify for dependency injection, enabling interactive and dynamic diagramming within a web-based environment.
outcomes: Designed and implemented an interactive web-based component diagram editor.
Integrated GLSP with custom domain logic using Eclipse modeling tools.
Enhanced user interaction with real-time rendering via Sprotty and Inversify.

project2.title: Job Application-Process Portal
project2.description: Developed a Job Application Portal utilizing React, ASP.NET, Azure Blob Storage and File Services. This portal facilitates a streamlined application process for both recruiters and applicants, enabling comprehensive management of job applications from a single platform.
outcomes: Built a multi-role system for recruiters and applicants with secure file uploads.
Used Azure Blob/File services to handle CV/document storage efficiently.
Improved application visibility and tracking through intuitive UI design.

project3.title: Isik University Business and Economy club Website
project3.description: Developed the official website (Team of four) for the Business and Economics Club at our university using Node.js and Express.js for the backend. HTML/CSS/JS for the frontend. The project involved leading the frontend development efforts and coordinating with team members to ensure the platform provided essential information to over 200 members.
outcomes: Led frontend development and ensured responsive design implementation.
Collaborated with backend developers for seamless dynamic content delivery.
Launched a live platform used regularly by over 200 club members.

project4.title: Advanced Employee Management, Reservation & Contact Tracing App
project4.description: Developed a project (private Gitlab repository) that manages employee scheduling and office reservations during COVID-19. The backend was built using Node.js and Express.js, frontend utilized HTML and CSS.
outcomes: Created a scheduling system with real-time availability checks.
Implemented a contact tracing module for internal workplace safety.
Optimized reservation logic to comply with distancing protocols.

project5.title: Bus Ticket Intermediary
project5.description: Utilized the MERN stack to develop a bus ticket intermediary platform, with the code hosted on a private GitHub repository.
outcomes: Built a platform for users to search, compare, and book bus tickets.
Implemented user authentication and payment workflow simulation.
Ensured dynamic seat selection and ticket availability tracking.

project6.title: Exoplanet Finding and Similarity to Earth
project6.description: Developed a data analysis project using Jupyter Notebook and various Python libraries (such as Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, and Scikit-learn) to explore and evaluate the habitability of exoplanets. The project involved processing publicly available datasets (e.g., NASA Exoplanet Archive), filtering key planetary features (e.g., radius, mass, orbital period, surface temperature), and computing similarity metrics to Earth. Applied clustering and normalization techniques to identify potentially habitable exoplanets and visualize trends.
outcomes: Identified top candidates for Earth-like habitability.
Built visual dashboards to compare planetary features.
Gained experience in scientific computing and astrobiology data interpretation.

upcoming1.title: EdgeAI-Based Indoor Object Detection with Jetson Nano
upcoming1.description: This project focuses on deploying real-time object detection inside home environments using the NVIDIA Jetson Nano and deep learning models optimized for edge devices.

upcoming2.title: Beauty Services Booking Platform
upcoming2.description: Developing a web platform that connects freelance beauty service providers with customers, allowing for online booking, availability management, and home service scheduling. Built using Next.js, Node.js, and PostgreSQL.

upcoming3.title: Smart Water Level Monitoring with 3D-Printed Sensor
upcoming3.description: This project aims to monitor water levels in a specific location (e.g., tank or utility system) using embedded sensors and deployable hardware, as part of RheinMain Universityâ€™s smart campus initiative.
